section.title: AVLayer object
section.paragraph: The AVLayer object provides an interface to those layers that contain AVItem objects (composition layers, footage layers, solid layers, text layers, and sound layers).

block_quote.paragraph: AVLayer is a subclass of Layer object. All methods and attributes of Layer, in addition to those listed below, are available when working with AVLayer.
AVLayer is a base class for TextLayer object, so AVLayer attributes and methods are available when working with TextLayer objects.

section.paragraph: Different types of layers have different AE properties. AVLayer has the following properties and property groups:
If the first item in the project is a CompItem, and the first layer of that CompItem is an AVLayer, the following sets the layer quality, startTime, and inPoint.

section.title: AVLayer.adjustmentLayer
section.paragraph: True if the layer is an adjustment layer.
Boolean; read/write.

section.title: AVLayer.audioActive
section.paragraph: True if the layer’s audio is active at the current time. For this value to be true, audioEnabled must be true, no other layer with audio may be soloing unless this layer is soloed too, and the time must be between the inPoint and outPoint of this layer.
Boolean; read-only.

section.title: AVLayer.audioEnabled
section.paragraph: When true, the layer’s audio is enabled. This value corresponds to the audio toggle switch in the Timeline panel.
Boolean; read/write.

section.title: AVLayer.blendingMode
section.paragraph: The blending mode of the layer.
A BlendingMode enumerated value; read/write. One of:

section.title: AVLayer.canSetCollapseTransformation
section.paragraph: True if it is legal to change the value of the collapseTransformation attribute on this layer.
Boolean; read-only.

section.title: AVLayer.canSetTimeRemapEnabled
section.paragraph: True if it is legal to change the value of the timeRemapEnabled attribute on this layer.
Boolean; read-only.

section.title: AVLayer.collapseTransformation
section.paragraph: True if collapse transformation is on for this layer.
Boolean; read/write.

section.title: AVLayer.effectsActive
section.paragraph: True if the layer’s effects are active, as indicated by the <f> icon next to it in the user interface.
Boolean; read/write.

section.title: AVLayer.environmentLayer
section.paragraph: True if this is an environment layer in a Ray-traced 3D composition. Setting this attribute to true automatically makes the layer 3D (threeDLayer becomes true).
Boolean; read/write.

section.title: AVLayer.frameBlending
section.paragraph: True if frame blending is enabled for the layer.
Boolean; read-only.

section.title: AVLayer.frameBlendingType
section.paragraph: The type of frame blending to perform when frame blending is enabled for the layer.
A FrameBlendingType enumerated value; read/write. One of:

section.title: AVLayer.guideLayer
section.paragraph: True if the layer is a guide layer.
Boolean; read/write.

section.title: AVLayer.hasAudio
section.paragraph: True if the layer contains an audio component, regardless of whether it is audio-enabled or soloed.
Boolean; read-only.

section.title: AVLayer.hasTrackMatte

note.paragraph: This functionality was updated in After Effects 23.0. Track Matte is no longer dependent on layer order.

section.paragraph: True if this layer has track matte. When true, this layer’s trackMatteType value controls how the matte is applied. See AVLayer.trackMatteType for available track matte types.
Boolean; read-only.

section.title: AVLayer.height
section.paragraph: The height of the layer in pixels.
Floating-point; read-only.

section.title: AVLayer.isNameFromSource
section.paragraph: True if the layer has no expressly set name, but contains a named source. In this case, layer.name has the same value as layer.source.name. False if the layer has an expressly set name, or if the layer does not have a source.
Boolean; read-only.

section.title: AVLayer.isTrackMatte

note.paragraph: This functionality was updated in After Effects 23.0. Track Matte is no longer dependent on layer order.

section.paragraph: True if this layer is being used as a track matte.
Boolean; read-only.

section.title: AVLayer.motionBlur
section.paragraph: True if motion blur is enabled for the layer.
Boolean; read/write.

section.title: AVLayer.preserveTransparency
section.paragraph: True if preserve transparency is enabled for the layer.
Boolean; read/write.

section.title: AVLayer.quality
section.paragraph: The quality with which this layer is displayed.
A LayerQuality enumerated value; read/write. One of:

section.title: AVLayer.samplingQuality

note.paragraph: This functionality was added in After Effects 12.0 (CC)

section.paragraph: Set/get layer sampling method (bicubic or bilinear)
A LayerSamplingQuality enumerated value; read/write. One of:

section.title: AVLayer.source
section.paragraph: The source AVItem for this layer. The value is null in a Text layer. Use AVLayer.replaceSource() to change the value.
AVItem object; read-only.

section.title: AVLayer.threeDLayer
section.paragraph: True if this is a 3D layer.
Boolean; read/write.

section.title: AVLayer.threeDPerChar
section.paragraph: True if this layer has the Enable Per-character 3D switch set, allowing its characters to be animated off the plane of the text layer. Applies only to text layers.
Boolean; read/write.

section.title: AVLayer.timeRemapEnabled
section.paragraph: True if time remapping is enabled for this layer.
Boolean; read/write.

section.title: AVLayer.trackMatteLayer

note.paragraph: This functionality was added in After Effects 23.0

section.paragraph: Returns the track matte layer for this layer. Returns null if this layer has no track matte layer.
AVLayer object; read only.

section.title: AVLayer.trackMatteType

note.paragraph: This functionality was updated in After Effects 23.0

warning.paragraph: This is a Legacy API we don’t recommend using for setting Track Matte Type in new scripts. Please consider using the latest track matte APIs AVLayer.setTrackMatte() and AVLayer.removeTrackMatte() for your tasks.

section.paragraph: If this layer has a track matte, specifies the way the track matte is applied. Specifying the TrackMatteType.NO_TRACK_MATTE type will remove the track matte for this layer and reset the track matte type.
A TrackMatteType enumerated value; read/write. One of:

literal_block.inline: // Returns the current track matte type for myLayer
// *** We recommend using the new Track Matte APIs for the operations below (See Warning) ***
// Changes the track matte type for myLayer to TrackMatteType.ALPHA_INVERTED
// Removes the track matte and also resets the type

section.title: AVLayer.width
section.paragraph: The width of the layer in pixels.
Floating-point; read-only.

section.title: AVLayer.addToMotionGraphicsTemplate()

note.paragraph: This functionality was added in After Effects 18.0 (2021)

section.paragraph: Adds the layer to the Essential Graphics Panel for the specified composition.
Returns true if the layer is successfully added, or false otherwise.

list_item.paragraph: If the layer cannot be added, it is either because it is not a layer type for which media can be replaced (referred to as Media Replacement Layers), or the layer has already been added to the EGP for that composition. After Effects will present a warning dialog if the layer cannot be added to the EGP.
Use the AVLayer.canAddToMotionGraphicsTemplate() method to test whether the layer can be added to a Motion Graphics template.

entry.paragraph: A CompItem object; the composition where you wish to add the property to the EGP. Required.

section.paragraph: Boolean.

section.title: AVLayer.addToMotionGraphicsTemplateAs()

note.paragraph: This functionality was added in After Effects 18.0 (2021)

section.paragraph: Adds the layer to the Essential Graphics Panel for the specified composition.
Returns true if the layer is successfully added, or false otherwise.

list_item.paragraph: If the layer cannot be added, it is either because it is not a layer type for which media can be replaced (referred to as Media Replacement Layers), or the layer has already been added to the EGP for that composition. After Effects will present a warning dialog if the layer cannot be added to the EGP.
Use the AVLayer.canAddToMotionGraphicsTemplate() method to test whether the layer can be added to a Motion Graphics template.

entry.paragraph: A CompItem object; the composition where you wish to add the property to the EGP. Required.
A string for the new name. Required.

section.paragraph: Boolean.

section.title: AVLayer.audioActiveAtTime()
section.paragraph: Returns true if this layer’s audio will be active at the specified time. For this method to return true, audioEnabled must be true, no other layer with audio may be soloing unless this layer is soloed too, and the time must be between the inPoint and outPoint of this layer.

entry.paragraph: The time, in seconds. A floating-point value.

section.paragraph: Boolean.

section.title: AVLayer.calculateTransformFromPoints()
section.paragraph: Calculates a transformation from a set of points in this layer.

entry.paragraph: The top left point coordinates in the form of an array, [x , y, z] .
The top right point coordinates in the form of an array, [ x, y, z ] .
The bottom right point coordinates in the form of an array, [ x, y, z ] .

section.paragraph: An Object with the transformation properties set.

section.title: AVLayer.canAddToMotionGraphicsTemplate()

note.paragraph: This functionality was added in After Effects 18.0 (2021)

section.paragraph: Test whether or not the layer can be added to the Essential Graphics Panel for the specified composition.
Returns true if the layer can be added, or false otherwise.

If the layer cannot be added, it is either because it is not a layer type for which media can be replaced (referred to as Media Replacement Layers), or the layer has already been added to the EGP for that composition.
Media Replacement layers are recognized as AVLayers with an AVLayer.source set to a FootageItem object (with specific source types) or a CompItem object.
The AVLayer needs to comply with the restrictions below in order to be treated as a Media Replacement layer:

list_item.paragraph: If the AVLayer.source is a FootageItem object, then FootageItem.FootageSource should not be a SolidSource object.
If the AVLayer.source is a FootageItem object and the FootageItem.FootageSource is a FileSource object then that FileSource should not point to a non-media file e.g. a JSX script file.

entry.paragraph: A CompItem object; the composition where you wish to add the property to the EGP. Required.

section.paragraph: Boolean.

section.title: AVLayer.compPointToSource()

note.paragraph: This functionality was added in After Effects 13.2 (CC 2014.2)

section.paragraph: Converts composition coordinates, such as sourcePointToComp, to layer coordinates.

warning.paragraph: This value only reflects the first character in the text layer at the current time.

entry.paragraph: A position array of composition coordinates in ([X, Y]) format.

section.paragraph: Array of ([X,Y]) position coordinates; read-only.

section.title: AVLayer.openInViewer()
section.paragraph: Opens the layer in a Layer panel, and moves the Layer panel to front and gives it focus.
None.
Viewer object for the Layer panel, or null if the layer could not be opened (e.g., for text or shape layers, which cannot be opened in the Layer panel).

section.title: AVLayer.removeTrackMatte()

note.paragraph: This functionality was added in After Effects 23.0

section.paragraph: Removes the track matte for this layer while preserving the TrackMatteType. See AVLayer.setTrackMatte() for another way of removing track matte.
None.
Nothing.

literal_block.inline: // Sets the track matte layer of myLayer with otherLayer as LUMA type
// Removes the track matte for myLayer but preserves the LUMA type

section.title: AVLayer.replaceSource()
section.paragraph: Replaces the source for this layer.

entry.paragraph: True to adjust expressions for the new source, false otherwise. Note that this feature can be resource-intensive; if replacing a large amount of footage, do this only at the end of the operation. See also Project.autoFixExpressions().

section.paragraph: Nothing.

warning.paragraph: If this method is performed on a null layer, the layers isNull attribute is not changed from true. This causes the layer not to be visible in comp viewer and renders.

section.title: AVLayer.setTrackMatte()

note.paragraph: This functionality was added in After Effects 23.0

section.paragraph: Sets the track matte layer and type for this layer. Passing in null to trackMatteLayer parameter removes the track matte. See AVLayer.removeTrackMatte() for another way of removing track matte.

entry.paragraph: The AVLayer to be used as the track matte layer.
The type of the track matte to be used. Please see AVLayer.trackMatteType for available types.

warning.paragraph: Passing in TrackMatteType.NO_TRACK_MATTE as type is invalid and will result in no-op.

section.paragraph: Nothing

literal_block.inline: // Sets the track matte layer of myLayer with otherLayer as Alpha type
// Keeps the same trackMatteLayer and only changes the track matte type
// Changes the track matte layer but keep the same track matte type
// Removes the track matte for myLayer and sets the new specified TrackMatteType

section.title: AVLayer.sourcePointToComp()

note.paragraph: This functionality was added in After Effects 13.2 (CC 2014.2)

section.paragraph: Converts layer coordinates, such as boxTextPos, to composition coordinates.

warning.paragraph: This value only reflects the first character in the text layer at the current time.

entry.paragraph: A position array of layer coordinates in ([X, Y]) format.

section.paragraph: Array of ([X,Y]) position coordinates; read-only.

literal_block.inline: // For a paragraph text layer. // Converts position in layer coordinates to comp coordinates.

section.title: AVLayer.sourceRectAtTime()
section.paragraph: Retrieves the rectangle bounds of the layer at the specified time index, corrected for text or shape layer content. Use, for example, to write text that is properly aligned to the baseline.

entry.paragraph: The time index, in seconds. A floating-point value.
True to include the extents, false otherwise. Extents apply to shape layers, increasing the size of the layer bounds as necessary.

section.paragraph: A JavaScript object with four attributes, [top, left, width, height].
